reviews.sentence: My wife and I went to the Hard Rock Hotel in Atlantic city this past weekend. The facility and staff were pleasant. The only things we did nt like were we could not be seated at the Hard Rock Cafe for breakfast. We were previously told by the cafe employee that no reservation was needed for breakfast just come before 10 AM. We were there both days by 1030 AMOne day we were turned away and were told they are not serving breakfast any more even though it was only 1030 AM and we can see the kitchen staff prepaing egg omelets and pancakes. The second day we were turned away we were told the cafe was full. There was a football Eagles game playing last Saturday morning. The Cafe was only letting in Guests that had Eagles football shirts on. Also Saturday night in the North Tower Elevator was vomit on the floor of the elevator.

The hotel is clean and beautiful however the elevators broke and we had to go 33 floors with our luggage by foot on the stairs. The employees could have cared less and wee so rude as if we were a bother to them when we asked about the elevator situation when we waited for 20 minutes and no elevator came. We actually ended up missing our show we had tickets for as well. Nightmare.

What a difference. I have been to the Taj Mahal back when it was open and the place was a complete miserable dump and very tacky. So I was very surprised to see how cleaned up and attractive it has become with the newly opened Hard Rock. The room I got was a queen in the North Tower and below market entering the slower winter season but it was spacious and enough room for a desk sofa love seat and coffee table entertainment console and very large windows. The bathroom alone was large enough to sleep in. I love the glass door shower and complimentary Sweet Grass toiletries. The marble and stone look is definitely fresh and cleaner in appearance than the gaudy purple mauve gold and cheetah skin aesthetic of yesteryear. I did not get a chance to see the restaurants or entertainment but I will definitely be back for the great lineup of shows coming to town in the next months. HR is a great place to stay for a fun overnight or weekend trip out of town if you are local or coming from the NYC or Phily areas.
Celebrating a friend ’s 60th birthday. Dinner at buffet was wonderful. Comedy show afterwards. Spent the rest of the evening listening to live band in Casino loby ❤ ️.

Great stay. I had a great time. Everyone there was friendly from the people at Reception to the Security guys. Loved the room and the view. I had breakfast in the room one day and it arrived on time delicious. Hard Rock Cafe employees 2 thumbs up. Loved the gym and the pool. Will be back.

I think they did an amazing job on the design and great amenities. Honestly the check in lines on Saturday evening were very long. Does the hotel think its a surprise to have a lot of customers check in at onceSame with guest services 2 reps and a line with 30 guest. Very understaffed or mismanaged.
Loved all the memorabilia on display and the music theme throughout. Awesome being met in Atlantic City by Bruce on the big screens by escalator. Room and bath spotless. No complaints here.
Clean hotel friendly and helpful staff. The accommodation was great. Love my room lost my planner and house keeping for it down stair I was able to get it back. Honest staff.

Very nice rooms. Spacious comfortable and clean. Good selection of restaurants and amenities but it is a huge building and you have to walk a long way from the parking garage to check in and a long way to the room. There was a long line at check in even on a Wednesday in the off season. Parking was 10 per day here. Most of the other casinos have free parking.

Will definitely return. My sister and I went for a girl ’s night out stayed at the hotel only one night. It was great. Everywhere was very clean. the room the casino the hallways loaded with music memorabilia the restaurant and bar. They did a nice job on the decor not over the top glitzy a bit on the masculine side. We stayed in the South Tower the ocean was visible from our large window from an angle. I had an issue with my dinner at the HR Cafe but it was immediately corrected. I ’m only sorry it was a one night stay I would like to have spent more time and checked out the pool and other restaurants.
The elevators broke down as we were going to check out. We were on the 33rd floor and had to wait 30 minutes or more for an elevator. Everything else was wonderful would definitely go back.
The elevator service could have been better. Two of four elevators in the north tower were out of service causing a crowd condition at check out time.
I like the use of the gym even though it was not very big and you had to pay extra for it had some issue with my toilet it was not working properly.

Only two out of four elevators were working. Long long wait times to use the elevator. Check out a half an hour to get into an elevator to leave the property. They did not have the room available that we had requested. We got a smoking room that smelled.

Liked the layout of the various food places. While a large property it was easy to figure out after a day of wandering. The elevators were a bit of a problem in that the button for our floor 18 did not work in two of them. The bathtub did not drain properly. Had to line up for about 40 minutes to check in.

Best modern and lively resort on the boardwalk. Disappointed with housekeeping. Had to speak to two employees and finally go down to main lobby front desk to request cleaning. Dirty room service table in hallway for two days. Air conditioning throughout hotel should be stronger.
Clean and comfortable. Only drawback was loud band in lobby bar. Made it difficult to talk and relax.
THE ROOMS WERE VERY CLEAN. WE STAYED IN A NON SMOKING PART OF THE HOTEL BUT WE STILL SMELLED SMOKE COMING FROM THE HALLWAYS AND NEAR THE WINDOWS.

You can do better. We were put in a room next to the elevator and the elevator was so loud i did not sleep the entire night. It was so loud friends in the room on the other side of the elevator heard it THROUGH our room. I complained to the front desk about how loud it was and was told i should have asked for a room away from the elevator. I was totally dismissed.

What I like the most from the Hard Rock was that I had so many varieties of things to choose from multiple food vendor and entertainment. What I least enjoyed was getting lost in the elevator and staff not being available or friendly to assist.
